Reviews.Content: Over the Hill! This property is tired and badly needs refurbishment, both to the rooms/facility and to the attitude of key members of the staff. The public areas are beautiful but then you have to go to rooms where there is no temperature control and you can't open the windows without letting in every biting insect imaginable, showers are broken, and TVs barely work. (A bellman worked over an hour to get ours to turn on.) Not even a three star hotel when strictly evaluating room comfort, cleanliness, and staff. (However, the breakfast servers were Great!)
Reviews.Author: garpay

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel We have stayed at some of the best hotels in Europe and we would place Villa Cora near the top. The concierge staff bent over backwards for us and was as pleasant as can be. Stefano and Roberto were friendly and always smiling. They always greeted us, made reservations for everything within minutes of our requests, and were knowledegeable about restaurants, museums, and transportation. The breakfasts were delicious with some of the best fruits and croissants. We were able to order eggs whatever way you desired with a variety of meats on the side. The pool was refreshing and the grounds beautiful. They are closing for reservation because the structure need some fixing but what would you expect with such a grand old villa. I'll be there when the renovation is completed.
Reviews.Author: mitch360

Reviews.Content: Better than Average Service, Great away-from-the-fray location We found the Villa Cora staff very helpful, especially after AlItlalia (dont ever use use that airline!) lost our luggage and didn't seem to care at all whether we ever got our bags back or not. They are doing a renovation soon, so i think some of the other reviewers may like the place more in the future.
Reviews.Author: EricMosk

Reviews.Content: Never Again My wife and I stayed a few days at the Villa Cora this Summer. We had visited Florence before and were really looking forward to our stay. We booked the Villa Cora because it has a pool and was close to the town centre AND because it was meant to be a 5 star hotel.1 Really unfriendly staff. I dont think the staff on the front desk liked to be disturbed. Most of their answers were monosyllabic and never with a smile. We never got a good morning or good evening from any of them.2 Hotel had its day. The Villa Cora used to be grand I expect. Now it appears run down and old. You have to eat all your meals by the pool in a sperate building. The main hotel building only has bedrooms. They do provide meals in the main hotel but only for visitors not hotel guests. The water from our shower ran across the bathroom floor. Everyday we had to put towels down to soak the water up. Probably a legitimate health and safety issue. The hotel also smells musty and looks a bit like a furtuniture stock room.3 Breakfast. The breakfast was very average and compared to a hotel we stayed in this Summer for a third of the prize. The staff at breakfast like the staff at reception really couldn't be bothered.I could go on but I hope you get the idea. Don't part with your money.On a bright note Florence is a lovely place and everyone else we met were friendly and great ambassadors for their country and city.
Reviews.Author: BritTraveller1971

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel After just returning from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Villa Cora, I have to disagree with the most recent reviews. My partner and I thought that the Hotel was beautiful - we were given a fabulous room with a stunning view over Florence and the pool was a wonderful and relaxing relief from the museum/gallery circuit of Florence in mid-summer.I would agree that the staff are not overwhelmingly friendly, but nor did I find them rude or unhelpful. Basically they left us alone unless we requested assistance - the rooms were cleaned throughout the day without any inconvenience to us; the pool staff were always helpful and I have no complaints about the advice given by the front of house staff in response to our queries. It was a relief to not to have to interact with the staff unless we felt we needed to. My partner and I were perfectly relaxed wandering through the Hotel in shorts/t-shirts after a day by the pool.The only downside to our stay was the price of the restaurant. We largely avoided this by planning our meals south of the river (about a 20 min walk). I would recommend that if you do stay here that you identify some nearby restaurants - many in the Piazza Santo Spirito are lovely.An extremely memorable stay!
Reviews.Author: Phonehome

Reviews.Content: The Epitomy of Rudeness Although the Villa Cora is a beautiful hotel, it's almost ruined by the unbelieveable snobiness of its employees (specifically, the front desk crew.) For some reason, these people believe that since they stand at a desk in a hotel all day and night, they are far above the hotel's lowly guests. I constantly got looks implying that I wasn't dressed well enough to step foot in the villa cora (oops, i must've left my designer duds at home) while the men at the front desk were dressed in ridiculous suits that look like something bought from Goodwill in 1980. The front desk crew attempted to con us into eating at the hotels restaurant, serving authentic italian dishes such as pumpkin risotto (gag.) If you plan on staying at the Villa Cora, don't expect any help from the conceirge and unless you want nasty looks, don't forget your designer clothes.
Reviews.Author: gelatolover617

Reviews.Content: Rude and Unhelpful I would not recommend this hotel. Though very pretty, the lack of guest service made my visit to Florence unenjoyable. The room air conditioning did not work, it stayed at about 82 degrees the entire time I was there. When I talked to the front desk they told me it was the same throughout the hotel and that there was nothing they could do about it. I found the front desk employees to be rude and unhelpful. My boyfriend lost his wallet in a taxi while in Florence. When I asked the front desk if they could help me calling the taxi companies they gave me a list a numbers to call. When I was told by the taxi companies that they didn't speak English or understand my Italian I asked the front desk to please help me by translating. The front desk clerk called 2 numbers and then told me that I would need to continue calling throughout the night because there was nothing else he could do. The next morning, I asked another person at the front desk if she would call. She said she would handle it. When I returned there was no message from her nor did anyone know what I was talking about. For the amount of stars attributed to this hotel, I was expecting high quality service. What was received was worse than a hostel.
Reviews.Author: bibi123

Reviews.Content: The pool was fantastic We (two adults and two teenagers) stayed at the Villa Cora for four nights in June 2006. On the plus side, the pool is wonderful. There's nothing like walking around Florence in 90 degree weather all day and then coming back to the Villa Cora's pool, swimming a few laps, and then getting a gin-and-tonic from the poolside bar while soaking up a few rays before getting ready for dinner. The rooftop garden also has a nice overlook of Florence. I didn't mind the distance from Florence, either, although it's too far to walk when it's really hot out. But it's a tradeoff- suburban peace and quiet plus pool versus hustle and bustle in the middle of shopping and sight-seeing. Also, the breakfast buffet (served poolside) was very good and the lobby was very pretty.On the negative side, the beds were awful (extremely thin mattresses on wooden platforms) and the air conditioning was weak; the front desk was indifferent at best; the bathrooms were antiquated; and the rooms were small and not particularly attractive.I am hard pressed to see why the Villa Cora is a 5-star hotel. The beds and rooms clearly knock it down to 4 stars in my book. But the pool is wonderful.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel We stayed here in September '05 for a few days. Very nice hotel both from the outside and interiorly. Rooms were very nice with a lovely big bed. A wee bit of a walk from the centre but definitely within walking distance and definitely worth it for the hotel and views. Would definitely recommend this to others.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great hotel, okay staff My husband and I stayed here during our trip to Italy. The hotel was beautiful, it had big spacious rooms and the location was quiet and peaceful. It's located on a hilltop so our room had a great view of Florence. The only negative aspect was some of the staff, specifically one of the front desk personnel. He was rude and a bit snobbish towards us. He treated us like we didn't belong in his hotel. Normally I would definately recommend this hotel, but due to this one person I would never come back here. If you make sure you wear your nice slacks and dress up everyday you should be okay, just don't pull out any sweats or you'll probably get the same type of service we did from this one guy. The rest of the staff were very pleasant and helpful with anything we needed. Also, don't get suckered into the the private day trips the hotel offers, there are bus/group trips that are a 1/4 of the price they're offering and lots of fun.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Our family of 4 (parents and 2 teenage boys) stayed in a junior suite for a week. It is a beautiful hotel. It is a bit of a walk to the city but we enjoyed the exercise and it forced us to walk off the wonderful meals. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night, excellent meal and were pampered by the attentive service. Service was good overall, front desk generally service oriented but a bit aloof at times (not a big surprise in Italy). If you don't mind staying a bit away from the middle of the town square, this is the place to stay!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Just right My friend and I just arrived back from 8 days in Italy. (February 2006) We visited my daughter in Florence and chose the Villa Cora over all the other 5 star hotels in Florence. There are many worthy of note. We chose the Villa Cora because it is located on the other side of the Arno in a residential setting. I had heard from my daughter that the city can be loud and overwhelming. We enjoyed the setting and the view very much. In the morning we could look out over the the city and at night the lights were twinkling below us. The hotel itself is the historic home of Napoleons sister and is very grand yet subdued. The staff were very attentive and the only disagreement that we had was that the car from the train station was not included as I had believed. The hotel has a car and will drive you to a pick up point where you can then walk to everything in the city. The hotel car is not allowed to drive guests around the city because the taxis think it's unfair competition. I do not understand that at all but that's the way it is. The room was beautiful (a junior suite) but the other rooms were drop dead gorgeous. We were there in the off season so there were very few guests and we were glad of that. I guess the city can get insanely crowded. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The restaurant was superb and they made a huge fuss over my daughters 21st birthday. I would also recommend the Fonbliu Spa just a 2 minute ride from the hotel and the only spa we found in Florence.
Reviews.Author: jtp123

Reviews.Content: 5* comfort; 5* prices! It is very hard to find fault with the Villa Cora. It is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful setting, and after a day walking the hot and dusty streets of Florence there is simply nothing better than cooling off in the fabulous pool, surrounded by greenery. Ignore the prices advertised on their website - we e-mailed the hotel direct and were offered a delux double for 鈧?50 per night, B  B. On arrival we were upgraded to a senior suite - a nice surprise and a great room. Having read other reviews on this site, I doubt there are any bad rooms, but would certainly ask for one in the main villa. Breakfast was perfect, served by the pool. Location is great - away from the madness but close enough. Very quiet at night. Shuttle service is useful (but why not at the weekends?) and failing that taxis can be summoned in minutes with one phone call - average cost 鈧?-10 and only 5 mins into town. So where does it lose marks? The overall impression is that you are staying in someone's grand country residence, but they have gone away and left their staff to look after you - and most are more than happy to do so. Previous reviews refer to variable assistance at reception, and they were spot on. On the first evening we asked if there were any very local restuarants we could go to for supper - the answer was a flat no! He wasn't wrong (there aren't) but he could have been a little more helpful - intead we asked the pool guy who gave us two great suggestions within 20 minutes walk, where the locals like to eat. Other gripe is with the bar prices - 2 soft drinks and a bowl of nuts at the pool came to 鈧?0! Even for a city like Florence that must be close to a record, or am I just naive? Overall an excellent choice - 4.5/5 - and I would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: rednblackexile

Reviews.Content: Lovely mansion in residential district of Florence My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel Villa Cora for 2 nights during the month of June. The hotel is situated in the residential district of Florence, across the river and a 30 minute walk from downtown. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge was able to get us tickets to the Uffizi Gallery the day after we arrived and gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants. We were also up-graded to a suite. The hotel itself is an old mansion that has been converted into a hotel. If you like new, contemporary hotels this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for an Italian villa with antique furniture, painted mural ceilings and a relaxing environment - I would highly recommend it. One last note, the free shuttle that is advertised does not run on Saturdays or Sundays.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrific Place! Location is great! We arrived at the Villa Cora recently (mid March 05) and could not have been more pleased. The staff is excellent. They anticipate your needs. Staying 7 or 8 minutes from the noise and mayhem in Florence central district is just fine. We did not know if we would enjoy a 'residential area' as American Express described the location. Actually, it is a very fine hotel just a few minutes from the museums and restaurants of Florence. The location is not a problem at all and actually was a plus for us. Luigi and his staff are the best. The hotel was quite. We woke to bird chirps out our window! The staff will take you at anytime up until 6 pm to central Florence for free. If you stay late a cab ride back to Villa Cora is about 7 or 8 EU. We stayed in several hotels around Italy and while all were good, the Villa Cora stands out as the very best! The hotel is full of antique furniture, has hardwood floors, marble everywhere and very high ceilings. Don't expect that this will lead to a staff with an 'attitude', they anticipate your needs, they are there when you need them and are very professional at what they do. At one point I complimented Luigi (the manager) about something and his reponse was that's Villa Cora. The Villa Cora is not a hotel trying to be something, it is simply the Villa Cora and you will be very pleased.
Reviews.Author: minitor

Reviews.Content: the best the best in Florence, great staff, especially at front desk, location is perfect, in the quiet area of Viale dei Colli, few steps to centre. A shuttle service is available. We spent 5 days, last Oct. in this unique example of neo classic style and we did enjoy our vacation. Surely next year we will be back at Villa Cora.
Reviews.Author: motoilaria

Reviews.Content: Lovely Palazzo with pool The hotel and pool are both lovely. I had a double room at a reduced rate through orbitz in the adjacent building. The room was adequate though it looked on to the laundry and was dark. Friends were in a corner room with two double beds in the main building that was large with views of the city and the pool. The staff for the most part was quite friendly however the front desk staff was not. The men at the front desk (all men, never saw a woman) seemed quite put out that they were expected to deal with guests. It was a shock given how nice the rest of the staff was. If you can laugh at that sort of attitude as we did, it's a non-issue though.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Villa Cora - a Gem in Tuscany! If you want to stay where Anthony Hopkins, Roy Scheider, or other celebs stay and be treated just like them, then you need to stay at the Grand Hotel Villa Cora in breathtaking Firenze!Every year (sometimes twice a year, depending on the level of stress that needs to be detoxed from my busy life), I travel to Italy - my favorite country and Florence - my favorite city in the entire world!I discovered Villa Cora in 2001 and go there regularly to be pampered with multiple options that range from luxurious salt baths, luscious robes; unbelieveably sleeping accommodations; incomparable Florentine cuisine, and with every attention to detail you can imagine or not imagine. This hotel is definitely a Destination Hotel - 5 Star Luxury Hotel!The hotel is situated in the most exclusive neighborhood in Florence - where multi-million dollar/euro villas line Tuscan roads. I usually wake in the morning and take brisk walks in my bird-whistling, antiquated tree-towering neighborhood and can actually feel invigorated as I breath the Tuscan air (you must remember I live in California).Always e-mail ahead of time and make sure your e-mail is to the attention of Stefano - Chief Concierge. As a guest I have known Stefano for four years and he will do whatever it takes to make sure you will never forget your time in Florence such as assuring that you have a limousine waiting for you at the airport/train station; coordinate a day trip to San Gimigano with shopping/lunch and wine tasting, or even coordinate your wedding at this unparalled hotel. In fact, I plan to invite my guests to this hotel for my wedding ceremony on its grounds when I walk down the aisle.For the very best attention to detail, ask for Stefano and let him know that Darlene from Solvang, California sent you. You will be treated like a prince or princess, which you are!Enjoy and treat yourself to this memorable and regenerating experience - you deserve it!
Reviews.Author: firenzetraveler

Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Cora - Fantastic! We went for our honeymoon there and did not know what to expect. The views form your bedroom is something to be admired. The whole suite was just one of the best hotels I have ever visited. The only other hotel this good was the Mandarin Hotel in Kuala Lumpur. My wife and I will be visiting Villa Cora again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beautiful villa right outside the city This is a beautiful hotel, especially the public rooms where you feel as though you are royalty. The standard rooms are also quite nice, but a bit small. I would rec. a delux room in the main house upon booking. The pool and location are also terrific. It's great to take a swim while on vacation and having the hotel just outside the city gates is a pleasant plus. Who wants crowds all day long!The only unfortunate thing is the service. While many of the front desk folks are wonderful and helpful, a couple of them are very cranky...avoid the large man with the goatee and go to whoever else is on duty.Have fun!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: It really is a grand hotel The Villa Cora sits above Florence, which has both advantages and disadvantages. A walk down 30 minutes or so is through a lovely area of parks and big homes. The hotel furnishes complimentary limo service to and from the Ferragamo building on the via Tounabuoni. We stayed for a week early in March (this month). I made a reservation by phone while on a train from Venice to Florence and asked for a special rate. For 250 euros per night, we had a large suite a sitting room with a bath (shower only) and a bedroom with a full bath. Our view was over the swimming pool (not in use in March!) into a park-like area, and to the side we could see the rooftops of central Florence delightful. Service was impeccable. The hotel has an extensive and good breakfast buffet. Although we ate dinner down in the city each night, everything I heard about the hotel restaurant was favorable. Our daughter and another young woman joined us in Florence for two nights and they had an identical suite for the same price. Not only that, but when the hotel restaurant's maitre d' discovered our daughter was coming, he sent a box of chocolates (from Rivoire) and a bottle of champagne to their suite! Incidentally, the hotel also has access to the Internet. We were treated wonderfully throughout our stay. I'm not sure this had anything to do with it, but we were told that the hotel was struggling, and it seemed that they were hosting very few dinners or small conventions. Our visit also came at a time when Florence apparently had an unusually small number of tourists because of the impending war.
Reviews.Author: drover

Reviews.Content: Great hotel Wonderful hotel. Great service, beautiful rooms. The only bad point was that it was far from the city attractions.
Reviews.Author: lasvegasvisitor
